action.action-desc: Mr. Peters (for himself, Mr. Daines, and Mr. Tillis) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to provide for a review of the characterization or terms of discharge from the Armed Forces of individuals with mental health disorders alleged to affect terms of discharge.

section.header: Review of characterization or terms of discharge from the Armed Forces of individuals with mental health disorders alleged to affect terms of discharge
section.text: Section 1553(d) of title 10, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: In addition to the requirements of paragraphs (1) and (2), in the case of a former member described in subparagraph (B), the board shallâ€”

clause.text: review medical evidence of the Secretary of Veterans Affairs or a civilian health care provider that is presented by the former member; and

review the case with a rebuttable presumption in favor of the former member that post-traumatic stress disorder or traumatic brain injury materially contributed to the circumstances resulting in the discharge of a lesser characterization.

subparagraph.text: A former member described in this subparagraph is a former member described in paragraph (1) or a former member whose application for relief is based in whole or in part on matters relating to post-traumatic stress disorder or traumatic brain injury as supporting rationale or as justification for priority consideration whose post-traumatic stress disorder or traumatic brain injury is related to combat or military sexual trauma, as determined by the Secretary concerned.
